00060 /* ***************** generic editmode undo system ********************* */
00061 /*
00062  * Add this in your local code:
00063  *
00064  * void undo_editmode_push(bContext *C, const char *name, 
00065  *      void * (*getdata)(bContext *C),     // use context to retrieve current editdata
00066  *      void (*freedata)(void *),           // pointer to function freeing data
00067  *      void (*to_editmode)(void *, void *),        // data to editmode conversion
00068  *      void * (*from_editmode)(void *))      // editmode to data conversion
00069  *      int  (*validate_undo)(void *, void *))      // check if undo data is still valid
00070  *
00071  *
00072  * Further exported for UI is:
00073  *
00074  * void undo_editmode_step(bContext *C, int step);   // undo and redo
00075  * void undo_editmode_clear(void)               // free & clear all data
00076  * void undo_editmode_menu(void)                // history menu
00077  */
00078 
00079 /* ********************************************************************* */
00080 
00081 /* ****** XXX ***** */
00082 static void error(const char *UNUSED(arg)) {}
00083 /* ****** XXX ***** */
00084 
00085 
00086 #define MAXUNDONAME 64
00087 typedef struct UndoElem {
00088     struct UndoElem *next, *prev;
00089     ID id;          // copy of editmode object ID
00090     Object *ob;     // pointer to edited object
00091     int type;       // type of edited object
00092     void *undodata;
00093     uintptr_t undosize;
00094     char name[MAXUNDONAME];
00095     void * (*getdata)(bContext * C);
00096     void (*freedata)(void *);
00097     void (*to_editmode)(void *, void *, void *);
00098     void * (*from_editmode)(void *, void *);
00099     int (*validate_undo)(void *, void *);
00100 } UndoElem;
00101 
00102 static ListBase undobase = {NULL, NULL};
00103 static UndoElem *curundo = NULL;
00104 
00105 
00106 /* ********************* xtern api calls ************* */
00107 
00108 static void undo_restore(UndoElem *undo, void *editdata, void *obdata)
00109 {
00110     if (undo) {
00111         undo->to_editmode(undo->undodata, editdata, obdata);    
00112     }
00113 }
00114 
00115 /* name can be a dynamic string */
00116 void undo_editmode_push(bContext *C, const char *name, 
00117                         void * (*getdata)(bContext * C),
00118                         void (*freedata)(void *),
00119                         void (*to_editmode)(void *, void *, void *),
00120                         void *(*from_editmode)(void *, void *),
00121                         int (*validate_undo)(void *, void *))
00122 {
00123     UndoElem *uel;
00124     Object *obedit = CTX_data_edit_object(C);
00125     void *editdata;
00126     int nr;
00127     uintptr_t memused, totmem, maxmem;
00128 
00129     /* at first here was code to prevent an "original" key to be inserted twice
00130      * this was giving conflicts for example when mesh changed due to keys or apply */
00131     
00132     /* remove all undos after (also when curundo==NULL) */
00133     while (undobase.last != curundo) {
00134         uel = undobase.last;
00135         uel->freedata(uel->undodata);
00136         BLI_freelinkN(&undobase, uel);
00137     }
00138     
00139     /* make new */
00140     curundo = uel = MEM_callocN(sizeof(UndoElem), "undo editmode");
00141     BLI_strncpy(uel->name, name, sizeof(uel->name));
00142     BLI_addtail(&undobase, uel);
00143     
00144     uel->getdata = getdata;
00145     uel->freedata = freedata;
00146     uel->to_editmode = to_editmode;
00147     uel->from_editmode = from_editmode;
00148     uel->validate_undo = validate_undo;
00149     
00150     /* limit amount to the maximum amount*/
00151     nr = 0;
00152     uel = undobase.last;
00153     while (uel) {
00154         nr++;
00155         if (nr == U.undosteps) break;
00156         uel = uel->prev;
00157     }
00158     if (uel) {
00159         while (undobase.first != uel) {
00160             UndoElem *first = undobase.first;
00161             first->freedata(first->undodata);
00162             BLI_freelinkN(&undobase, first);
00163         }
00164     }
00165 
00166     /* copy  */
00167     memused = MEM_get_memory_in_use();
00168     editdata = getdata(C);
00169     curundo->undodata = curundo->from_editmode(editdata, obedit->data);
00170     curundo->undosize = MEM_get_memory_in_use() - memused;
00171     curundo->ob = obedit;
00172     curundo->id = obedit->id;
00173     curundo->type = obedit->type;
00174 
00175     if (U.undomemory != 0) {
00176         /* limit to maximum memory (afterwards, we can't know in advance) */
00177         totmem = 0;
00178         maxmem = ((uintptr_t)U.undomemory) * 1024 * 1024;
00179 
00180         uel = undobase.last;
00181         while (uel && uel->prev) {
00182             totmem += uel->undosize;
00183             if (totmem > maxmem) break;
00184             uel = uel->prev;
00185         }
00186 
00187         if (uel) {
00188             if (uel->prev && uel->prev->prev)
00189                 uel = uel->prev;
00190 
00191             while (undobase.first != uel) {
00192                 UndoElem *first = undobase.first;
00193                 first->freedata(first->undodata);
00194                 BLI_freelinkN(&undobase, first);
00195             }
00196         }
00197     }
00198 }
00199 
00200 /* helper to remove clean other objects from undo stack */
00201 static void undo_clean_stack(bContext *C)
00202 {
00203     UndoElem *uel, *next;
00204     Object *obedit = CTX_data_edit_object(C);
00205     
00206     /* global undo changes pointers, so we also allow identical names */
00207     /* side effect: when deleting/renaming object and start editing new one with same name */
00208     
00209     uel = undobase.first;
00210     while (uel) {
00211         void *editdata = uel->getdata(C);
00212         int isvalid = 0;
00213         next = uel->next;
00214         
00215         /* for when objects are converted, renamed, or global undo changes pointers... */
00216         if (uel->type == obedit->type) {
00217             if (strcmp(uel->id.name, obedit->id.name) == 0) {
00218                 if (uel->validate_undo == NULL)
00219                     isvalid = 1;
00220                 else if (uel->validate_undo(uel->undodata, editdata))
00221                     isvalid = 1;
00222             }
00223         }
00224         if (isvalid) 
00225             uel->ob = obedit;
00226         else {
00227             if (uel == curundo)
00228                 curundo = NULL;
00229 
00230             uel->freedata(uel->undodata);
00231             BLI_freelinkN(&undobase, uel);
00232         }
00233         
00234         uel = next;
00235     }
00236     
00237     if (curundo == NULL) curundo = undobase.last;
00238 }
00239 
00240 /* 1= an undo, -1 is a redo. we have to make sure 'curundo' remains at current situation */
00241 void undo_editmode_step(bContext *C, int step)
00242 {
00243     Object *obedit = CTX_data_edit_object(C);
00244     
00245     /* prevent undo to happen on wrong object, stack can be a mix */
00246     undo_clean_stack(C);
00247     
00248     if (step == 0) {
00249         undo_restore(curundo, curundo->getdata(C), obedit->data);
00250     }
00251     else if (step == 1) {
00252         
00253         if (curundo == NULL || curundo->prev == NULL) error("No more steps to undo");
00254         else {
00255             if (G.debug & G_DEBUG) printf("undo %s\n", curundo->name);
00256             curundo = curundo->prev;
00257             undo_restore(curundo, curundo->getdata(C), obedit->data);
00258         }
00259     }
00260     else {
00261         /* curundo has to remain current situation! */
00262         
00263         if (curundo == NULL || curundo->next == NULL) error("No more steps to redo");
00264         else {
00265             undo_restore(curundo->next, curundo->getdata(C), obedit->data);
00266             curundo = curundo->next;
00267             if (G.debug & G_DEBUG) printf("redo %s\n", curundo->name);
00268         }
00269     }
00270     
00271     /* special case for editmesh, mode must be copied back to the scene */
00272     if (obedit->type == OB_MESH) {
00273         EDBM_selectmode_to_scene(C);
00274     }
00275 
00276     DAG_id_tag_update(&obedit->id, OB_RECALC_DATA);
00277 
00278     /* XXX notifiers */
00279 }
00280 
00281 void undo_editmode_clear(void)
00282 {
00283     UndoElem *uel;
00284     
00285     uel = undobase.first;
00286     while (uel) {
00287         uel->freedata(uel->undodata);
00288         uel = uel->next;
00289     }
00290     BLI_freelistN(&undobase);
00291     curundo = NULL;
00292 }
00293 
00294 /* based on index nr it does a restore */
00295 void undo_editmode_number(bContext *C, int nr)
00296 {
00297     UndoElem *uel;
00298     int a = 1;
00299     
00300     for (uel = undobase.first; uel; uel = uel->next, a++) {
00301         if (a == nr) break;
00302     }
00303     curundo = uel;
00304     undo_editmode_step(C, 0);
00305 }
00306 
00307 void undo_editmode_name(bContext *C, const char *undoname)
00308 {
00309     UndoElem *uel;
00310     
00311     for (uel = undobase.last; uel; uel = uel->prev) {
00312         if (strcmp(undoname, uel->name) == 0)
00313             break;
00314     }
00315     if (uel && uel->prev) {
00316         curundo = uel->prev;
00317         undo_editmode_step(C, 0);
00318     }
00319 }
00320 
00321 /* undoname optionally, if NULL it just checks for existing undo steps */
00322 int undo_editmode_valid(const char *undoname)
00323 {
00324     if (undoname) {
00325         UndoElem *uel;
00326         
00327         for (uel = undobase.last; uel; uel = uel->prev) {
00328             if (strcmp(undoname, uel->name) == 0)
00329                 break;
00330         }
00331         return uel != NULL;
00332     }
00333     return undobase.last != undobase.first;
00334 }
00335 
00336 
00337 /* get name of undo item, return null if no item with this index */
00338 /* if active pointer, set it to 1 if true */
00339 const char *undo_editmode_get_name(bContext *C, int nr, int *active)
00340 {
00341     UndoElem *uel;
00342     
00343     /* prevent wrong numbers to be returned */
00344     undo_clean_stack(C);
00345     
00346     if (active) *active = 0;
00347     
00348     uel = BLI_findlink(&undobase, nr);
00349     if (uel) {
00350         if (active && uel == curundo)
00351             *active = 1;
00352         return uel->name;
00353     }
00354     return NULL;
00355 }
00356 
00357 
00358 void *undo_editmode_get_prev(Object *ob)
00359 {
00360     UndoElem *ue = undobase.last;
00361     if (ue && ue->prev && ue->prev->ob == ob) return ue->prev->undodata;
00362     return NULL;
00363 }
